member.name: M:Spire.License.LicenseProvider.UnbindDevelopmentOrTestingLicenses(System.Type,System.String@)
member.summary: Unbinds development or testing licenses of the specified type. The approach to lifting development or testing licenses does not allow frequent invocation by the same machine code, mandating a two-hour wait period before it can be invoked again.
member.param: The type of the license to unbind.
The error message in case of failure.
member.returns: True if at least one development or test license was unbound, otherwise false.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CompoundFile.BuiltInProperty.CharactersWithSpaces
member.summary: MUST be a VT_I4 TypedPropertyValue ([MS-OLEPS] section 2.15) property. The integer value of the property specifies an Eschertimate of the number of characters in the document including whitespace.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CompoundFile.BuiltInProperty.ShareDoc
member.summary: MUST be a VT_BOOL TypedPropertyValue ([MS-OLEPS] section 2.15) property. The property value MUST be FALSE (0x00000000).

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CompoundFile.BuiltInProperty.LinkBase
member.summary: MUST NOT be written (to built-in properties). The base URL property is persisted to the User Defined Property Set with the _PID_LINKBASE property name.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CompoundFile.BuiltInProperty.Hyperlinks
member.summary: MUST NOT be written (to built-in properties). The hyperlinks property is persisted to the User Defined Property Set with the _PID_HLINKS property name.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CompoundFile.BuiltInProperty.HyperlinksChanged
member.summary: MUST be a VT_BOOL TypedPropertyValue ([MS-OLEPS] section 2.15) property. The property value specifies TRUE (any value other than 0x00000000) if the _PID_HLINKS property in the User Defined Property Set has changed outside of the application, which would require hyperlink fix up on document load.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CompoundFile.BuiltInProperty.Version
member.summary:
Version of the application that created the document.
MUST be a VT_I4 TypedPropertyValue ([MS-OLEPS] section 2.15) property. The unsigned integer value of the property specifies the version of the application that wrote the property set storage. The two high order bytes specify an unsigned integer specifying the major version number. The two low order bytes specify an unsigned integer specifying the minor version number. The value MUST have the major version number set to a nonzero value, and the minor version number SHOULD always be 0x0000. The minor version number MAY be set to the minor version number of the application that wrote the property set storage.

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.Documents.Borders
member.summary:
Represents a collection of the border.
When dealing with page borders and image borders, only four basic border options are provided: left border, top border, right border and bottom border. Any attempt to apply border designs beyond these four basic styles will result in the system issuing error notifications, ensuring that your actions comply with established rules.
When dealing with paragraph borders and table borders, only six basic border options are provided: left border, top border, right border, bottom border, horizontal border and vertical border. Any attempt to apply border designs beyond these six basic styles will result in the system issuing error notifications, ensuring that your actions comply with established rules.
When dealing with cell borders, only six basic border options are provided: left border, top border, right border, bottom border, diagonalDown border and diagonalUp border. Any attempt to apply border designs beyond these six basic styles will result in the system issuing error notifications, ensuring that your actions comply with established rules.

member.summary: Initializes an instance of this class.

member.name: P:Spire.Doc.Documents.Markup.CustomXmlPart.Id
member.summary: Gets or sets the string that identifies this custom XML part within an OOXML document.

remarks.para: ISO/IEC 29500 specifies that this value is a GUID, but Microsoft Word seems to allow any string value for this property and Spire.Words does the same. A valid value must be an identifier that is unique among all custom XML data parts in this document.
The default value is an empty string. The value cannot be null.

member.name: P:Spire.Doc.Documents.Markup.CustomXmlPart.Data
member.summary: Gets or sets the XML content of this Custom XML Data Storage Part.

remarks.para: The default value is an empty byte array. The value cannot be null.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.Documents.Markup.CustomXmlPart.Clone
member.summary: Makes a "deep enough" copy of the object. Does not duplicate the bytes of the value.

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.Documents.Markup.CustomXmlPartCollection
member.summary: Represents a collection of Custom XML Parts. The items are objects.

remarks.para: You do not normally need to create instances of this class. You can access custom XML data stored in a document via the property.

summary.para: This element specifies the language ID which shall be used for displaying a calendar for the current date picker structured document tag, if a user interface is present for the sdt.
If this element is omitted, then the language ID shall be the language ID of the run contents of the parent structured document tag.

member.summary: The element specifies the display format which shall be used to format any date entered into the parent structured document tag in full DateTime format [Example: Through a user interface (a date picker), or through custom XML data associated with this structured document tag via the element end example] before displaying it in the structured document tag's run content.

member.summary: Specifies the possible types of calendars which can be used to specify in an Office Open XML document.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.Default
member.summary: Used as default value in Docx. Equals .

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.Gregorian
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. This calendar should be localized into the appropriate language.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.GregorianArabic
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in Arabic.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.GregorianMiddleEastFrench
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in Middle East French.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.GregorianEnglish
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be presented in English.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.GregorianTransliteratedEnglish
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be the representation of the English strings in the corresponding Arabic characters (the Arabic transliteration of the English for the Gregorian calendar).

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.GregorianTransliteratedFrench
member.summary: Specifies that the Gregorian calendar, as defined in ISO 8601, shall be used. The values for this calendar should be the representation of the French strings in the corresponding Arabic characters (the Arabic transliteration of the French for the Gregorian calendar).

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.Hebrew
member.summary: Specifies that the Hebrew lunar calendar, as described by the Gauss formula for Passover [CITATION] and The Complete Restatement of Oral Law (Mishneh Torah),shall be used.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.Hijri
member.summary: Specifies that the Hijri lunar calendar, as described by the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, Ministry of Islamic Affairs, Endowments, Dawah and Guidance, shall be used.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.Japan
member.summary: Specifies that the Japanese Emperor Era calendar, as described by Japanese Industrial Standard JIS X 0301, shall be used.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.Korean
member.summary: Specifies that the Korean Tangun Era calendar, as described by Korean Law Enactment No. 4, shall be used.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.None
member.summary: Specifies that no calendar should be used.
member.remarks: Usually in AW, None is the first and default value for enums, but not in this case. None is not default for OOXML, instead is default and is first member of this enum.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.Saka
member.summary: Specifies that the Saka Era calendar, as described by the Calendar Reform Committee of India, as part of the Indian Ephemeris and Nautical Almanac, shall be used.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.Taiwan
member.summary: Specifies that the Taiwanese calendar, as defined by the Chinese National Standard CNS 7648, shall be used.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.CalendarType.Thai
member.summary: Specifies that the Thai calendar, as defined by the Royal Decree of H.M. King Vajiravudh (Rama VI) in Royal Gazette B. E. 2456 (1913 A.D.) and by the decree of Prime Minister Phibunsongkhram (1941 A.D.) to start the year on the Gregorian January 1 and to map year zero to Gregorian year 543 B.C., shall be used.

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection
member.summary: Defines the direction of text.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.TopToBottom
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from left to right horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.RightToLeftRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from top to bottom vertically, then right to left horizontally on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically. This flow is also rotated such that all text is rotated 90 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.LeftToRight
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from bottom to top vertically, then from left to right horizontally on the page.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.RightToLeft
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from right to left horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.TopToBottomRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from left to right horizontally, then top to bottom vertically on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically. This flow is also rotated such that any East Asian text shall be rotated 270 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Documents.TextDirection.LeftToRightRotated
member.summary: Specifies that text in the parent object shall flow from top to bottom vertically, then left to right horizontally on the page. This means that horizontal lines are filled before the text expands vertically. This flow is also rotated such that all text is rotated 90 degrees when displayed on a page.

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.Formatting.Revisions.EditRevision
member.summary:
Represents info about an insert or delete revision, occurs on runs of text.
Three different revision operations are possible on a run: inserted, deleted or formatted. Formatted revision can be combined with deleted or inserted revision. A piece of text can be inserted by one author and deleted by another author, in this case both insert and delete revisions can be present on a run.
1. Formatted is same as formatting change revision on other objects, for example section properties. There is an sprm that is followed by sprms for the properties that have changed. We read this into revision attributes collection and store it as an attribute in the run attribute collection. 2. Inserted and deleted in WordML actually come not inside rPr element, but at the level of the r element.

member.name: P:Spire.Doc.Formatting.Revisions.EditRevision.Type
member.summary: Indicates whether the run is inserted or deleted during the revision.

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.Formatting.Revisions.EditRevisionType
member.summary:
The type of revision mark. Note that MS Word VBA defines many different revision types that are not really documented and I don't know if they are used or not, for example wdRevisionDisplayField.
Revision types are much simpler in WordML so this enumeration is more similar to WordML than to MS Word VBA.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Formatting.Revisions.EditRevisionType.Insertion
member.summary: Type of revision mark is insertion.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.Formatting.Revisions.EditRevisionType.Deletion
member.summary: Type of revision mark is Deletion.

member.name: M:Spire.Doc.License.LicenseProvider.UnbindDevelopmentOrTestingLicenses
member.summary: Unbind development or testing licenses. Only development or testing licenses can be unbound, deployment licenses cannot be unbound. The approach to lifting development or testing licenses does not allow frequent invocation by the same machine code, mandating a two-hour wait period before it can be invoked again.
member.returns: Returns true if the unbinding operation was successful; otherwise, false.

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.WidthType
member.summary: The TableWidthType enum specifies how the preferred width for a table, table indent, table cell, cell margin, or cell spacing is defined.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.WidthType.None
member.summary: No Preffered Width

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.WidthType.Auto
member.summary: No preferred width is specified. The width is derived from other table measurements where a preferred size is specified, as well as from the size of the table contents, and the constraining size of the container of the table.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.WidthType.Percentage
member.summary: When specifying the preferred width of a portion of a table, such as a cell, spacing or indent, the percentage is relative to the width of the entire table. When specifying the preferred width of an entire table, the percentage is relative to the width of the page, less any margin or gutter space. Alternatively, if the table is nested inside another table, the percentage is relative to the width of the cell in the containing table, less cell margins.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.WidthType.Twip
member.summary: The preferred width of the table, indent, cell, cell margin, or cell spacing is an absolute width measured in twips.

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.PreferredWidth
member.summary: An PreferredWidth class that specifies the preferred total width of the table of which this row is a part.

member.summary: Creates a PreferredWidth instance from a percentage value.
member.param: The percentage value representing the preferred width, which must be between 0 and MaxPercent.
member.returns: A PreferredWidth instance set to the specified percentage.

member.summary: Creates a PreferredWidth object from a specified number of points.
member.returns: A PreferredWidth object representing the specified width in points.

member.summary: Create a new PreferredWidth object
member.param: An short value that specifies the preferred width

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.CellWidthType
member.summary: Specifies preferred width type

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CellWidthType.Auto
member.summary: No preferred width is specified. The width is derived from other table measurements where a preferred size is specified, as well as from the size of the table contents, and the constraining size of the container of the table.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CellWidthType.Percentage
member.summary: Preferred table width specified in percentage

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CellWidthType.Point
member.summary: Preferred table width specified in points

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.LayoutType
member.summary: This simple type defines the possible type of layout algorthms which can be used to layout a table within a WordprocessingML document.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.LayoutType.Fixed
member.summary: Specifies that this table shall use the fixed width table layout algorithm described above.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.LayoutType.AutoFit
member.summary: Specifies that this table shall use an AutoFit table layout algorithm.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CharacterSpacing.doNotCompress
member.summary: Don't compress punctuation.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CharacterSpacing.compressPunctuation
member.summary: Compress punctuation.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.CharacterSpacing.compressPunctuationAndJapaneseKana
member.summary: Compress punctuation and japanese kana.

member.name: T:Spire.Doc.FrameSizeRule
member.summary: Frame size rule.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.FrameSizeRule.AtLeast
member.summary: Frame's height should be at least the value of the h attribute.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.FrameSizeRule.Exact
member.summary: Frame's width or height should be exactly the value of the w or h attribute.

member.name: F:Spire.Doc.FrameSizeRule.Auto
member.summary: Frame's width or height should be automatically.The w or h value is ignored.
